numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a graph.
2. In the graph, Indonesia has the highest percentage of older people who agree that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. In the graph, Indonesia has the highest percentage of younger people who agree that the world is getting better with each generation.
4. I notice my country.
5. My country is the U.S.
6. In the graph, the percentage for older people in the U.S. is lower than 50 percent.
7. In the graph, the percentage for younger people in the U.S. is higher than 50 percent.
8. I was surprised.
9. I expected fewer optimistic people in the U.S.
10. In the interview, more people in the U.S. were optimistic than I expected.
11. The U.S. feels socially divided to me.
12. I wonder why the countries in the lower half of the graph have the lowest numbers.
13. It is possible that the living situations for these people are worsening.
14. It is possible that these people worry about global warming.
15. It is possible that these people worry about pollution affecting the world.
16. This graph relates to me and my community.
17. The U.S. has surprising statistics in the graph.
18. I believe that the world is getting worse.
19. I believe that newer generations try hard to separate themselves from older generations.
20. I believe that older generations try hard to separate themselves from newer generations.
21. The headline is: opinions divided.
